metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39802 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In change_pte_range of mprotect.c , there is a possible way to make a shared mmap writable due to a permissions bypass. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-213339151References: Upstream kernel

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39802` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1079-fips - 4.4.0-1079.86
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
